snippet: Prime minister David Cameron spoke of “a shocking level of state collusion” in the 1989 death, but Patrick Finucane’s widow said the government was still covering up.
abstract: British Prime Min David Cameron offers apology to family of Patrick Finucane, lawyer who represented Irish Republican Army activists and was shot dead in 1989; Cameron observes that 500-page government-commissioned report on killing shows that there had been 'shocking level of state collusion' in killing.
lead_paragraph: Prime minister David Cameron spoke of “a shocking level of state collusion” in the 1989 death, but Patrick Finucane’s widow said the government was still covering up.

headline.seo: Cameron Apologizes for British Role in Finucane Killing
headline.main: British Premier Apologizes in Killing of I.R.A. Lawyer
headline.print_headline: British Premier Apologizes In Killing of I.R.A. Lawyer
